definition: to be of one mind/to think or act alike
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We are all of a mind.
TOM'S mind was made up now.
It seemed as though that mass had become a monster and had but one soul.
sentences.chinese: 那一大隊人馬彷彿變成了一個怪物，並且只有一條心。

sentences.english: A couple of one mind, mud into gold.
sentences.chinese: 夫婦一條心，泥土變黃金。

sentences.english: No two men are of a mind.
sentences.chinese: 沒有兩個人是同一條心的。

sentences.english: I only horizontal under a heart, crustily skin of head.
sentences.chinese: 我只有橫下一條心，硬着頭皮上了。
夫婦一條心，泥土變黃金。

sentences.english: The miners were solid on this issue .
sentences.chinese: 礦工們在這件事上是一條心的。

sentences.english: But such calls for national unity are falling on deaf ears.
sentences.chinese: 但是這種全國一條心的呼籲正進了聾子耳朵。

sentences.english: If we are all concerned only about ourselves we cannot come together with one mind.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們完全考慮自己就不會一條心。

sentences.english: Love is two minds without a single thought.

definition: to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
to discharge one's duties/conscientious
prosperous and developing/flourishing
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
memorial speech/eulogy
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to talk about everything
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
disagreement/differing interpretations
